Have a look a the source code of this HTML file!

This example code loads the file 'gps-ops.txt' containing multiple TLE records, which describe the position and movement of satellites. The file is loaded asynchronously using an XMLHttpRequest.

When the entire file is loaded, the stateChange() function is called, which calls parseSatellites(). parseSatellites() parses the TLE records and stores the result in the global satellites array.

You can now call satellitePosition() to get the position of a satellite for a specific time. The current time is
var now = new Date();

The code in printSample() illustrates how satellitePosition() can be used to get the satellite position 10 minutes from now. It uses the first satellite in the satellites array. The pos object in printSample() contains the longitude, latitude and the distance from the globe centre in kilometres.

To find the geometry of the orbit of a satellite, increase dT in printSample(). A GPS satellite rotates around the entire globe in a little less than 24 hours.
